publications.name: Development and testing of a game-based digital intervention for working memory training in autism spectrum disorder
publications.summary: The study developed and tested five smartphone-based games designed to improve working memory in children with autism spectrum disorder (ASD), considering their sensory preferences and behavioral traits. While the one-month pilot intervention showed no significant overall improvements, better in-game performance was linked to individual gains in working memory, suggesting potential with extended use.

publications.name: Computational insights into mRNA and protein dynamics underlying synaptic plasticity rules
publications.summary: This study presents computational models that integrate mRNA and protein dynamics to elucidate the mechanisms of synaptic plasticity. The findings highlight how local translation and molecular transport contribute to the regulation of synaptic strength, offering insights into the cellular processes underlying learning and memory.

publications.name: An Unguided, Computerized Cognitive Behavioral Therapy Intervention (TreadWill) in a Lower Middle-Income Country: Pragmatic Randomized Controlled Trial
publications.summary: This randomized controlled trial evaluates the effectiveness of TreadWill, an unguided computerized cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) program, in a lower middle-income country. The results demonstrate that TreadWill significantly reduces depressive symptoms among participants, suggesting its potential as a scalable mental health intervention in resource-limited settings.

publications.name: SpyDen: Automating molecular and structural analysis across spines and dendrites
publications.summary: SpyDen introduces an automated tool for the molecular and structural analysis of neuronal spines and dendrites. The software enhances the accuracy and efficiency of morphological assessments, facilitating large-scale studies of neuronal connectivity and plasticity.

publications.name: An integrative model of AMPA receptor trafficking reveals the central contribution of local translation in subtype-specific kinetics
publications.summary: This research presents an integrative model of AMPA receptor trafficking, emphasizing the pivotal role of local protein synthesis in determining receptor subtype kinetics. The study provides a comprehensive framework for understanding how localized translation influences synaptic transmission and plasticity.
